24.job_summary:
About this Job
Us: A fast paced, high tech, multi faceted company. We span multiple physical offices and occupy a large web presence. We thrive to maintain a friendly, open, and fun atmosphere that our staff love to show up to.
You: A technology enthusiast who thrives in a constantly evolving environment. You should be interested in learning new software, as well as working with new hardware. You should be able to maintain calm and composure in the instance where everything may be on fire, and even be excited about running straight forward into a challenge. You must be great with people, patient with those who are less technically inclined than you, and willing to help people learn how to work with tech better.
Responsibilities:
Provide first level technical support to our employees and contractors both on-site and remotely.
Handle the creation and maintenance of all accounts, including Active Directory, Hosted Exchange, etc.
Responsible for new PC setups, virus removal, software updates, and hardware incidents.
Operating system support for Windows 7/10.
Effectively communicate technical issues, ticket flows, and project execution with CTO and CFO.
Contribute findings and troubleshooting documentation to knowledge portal.
Update documentation with hardware information, password changes, etc.
Qualifications:
Proven ability to effectively interact with end-users (lay persons) in identifying and resolving technical issues
Unique ability to work with both business and technical minded people to plan and execute against project timelines and deliverables
An understanding of TCP/IP Networking Protocols and Procedures, all relevant Windows Workstation, Operating Systems, all relevant Windows Office products
Prior experience in a technical support role, IT sales, or call center environment
A passion for customer service and technology, delivering exceptional support to end-users
Ability to multi-task across clients, industries, and technologies, while maintaining an appropriate level of professionalism and composure
We have multiple locations, and travel between locations to deliver equipment is sometimes required. A reliable vehicle is a big plus.
A working knowledge of the following is necessary to perform daily activities:
Active Directory Users and Computers
Group policy
DNS
DHCP
File and Print Services
Microsoft Office Applications
Experience with VLANs, VPN, VMWare, FreePBX, or Linux a big plus.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $45,000.00 to $55,000.00 /year
Job Location:
Boston, MA 02134
Required experience:
Active Directory: 1 year
Helpdesk: 1 year
Windows Networking: 1 year
DNS: 1 year
DHCP: 1 year

26.job_summary:
We are looking for a Junior-level System Administrator for our Security R&D Team. Our focus is on developing security-related applications and tools. You would join a small group of system administrators who support the development & QA. Our environment is nearly 100% linux (CentOS mostly), virtualized with VMware, with attached SAN storage. Tools we use include: puppet, nagios, splunk, jenkins, perl, python, PHP, Java, just to name a few.
We are looking for a self-motivated person who wants to learn and grow on the team. Because of our team's makeup and our ever-changing needs, there are many opportunities to branch out into software development as well.
Location: Anywhere in the US. This is a 100% REMOTE work-from-home position.
HIRING REQUIREMENTS:
* US Citizenship
* Active DoD Security Clearance
* Linux+ certification within 3 months
* Security+ certification within 3 months
Required Skills: strong linux system administration experience, strong command-line skills, solid understanding of host & network security, good communication skills, self-learner, ability to work independently
Bonus skills: VMWare, Puppet, Jenkins, scripting (bash, perl, python, etc).
Email if interested. DO NOT APPLY if you do not have an active security clearance. This is a requirement for hiring and we cannot hire anyone without one.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $75,000.00 /year
Required experience:
Linux system administration: 2 years
Required language:
English
Required licenses or certifications:
Security+
Linux+
Active DoD Security Clearance

22.job_summary:
The Help Desk Technician maintains and monitors end-user workstations and productivity on local area network using SysAid Help Desk. Perform a variety of maintenance, software installation, end-user support and training tasks to ensure end-user workstations and network performance meet company and user requirements. Provide support to staff on all company-supported applications. Troubleshoot computer problems, determine source and advise on appropriate action. Complete application project-based work. Perform responsibilities in accordance with all company standards, policies and procedures.
Responsibilities: 
Administers end-user workstations and supports end-user activities utilizing TCP/IP on a primarily Microsoft Windows-based local area network (LAN).
Investigates user problems and identifies their source; determines possible solutions; tests and implements solutions.
Installs, configures and maintains personal computers, Windows networks, workstations, file servers, network cabling, and other related equipment, devices and systems; adds or upgrades and configures disk drives, printers and related equipment.
Performs and/or oversees software and application installation and upgrades.
Maintains site licenses for department/organization.
Plans and implements network security, including maintaining firewalls, configuring VPN, managing host security, file permissions, file system integrity, and adding and deleting users.
Troubleshoots networks, systems and applications to identify and correct malfunctions and other operational difficulties.
Develops and conducts various training and instruction for system users on operating systems and other applications; assists users in maximizing use of networks and computing systems.
Maintains confidentiality with regard to the information being processed, stored or accessed by the end-users on the network.
Assists personnel of other departments as a computer resource.
Provides computer orientation to new and existing company staff.
Mange and install Symantec end user workstation and updates.
Minimum Qualifications: 
Degree in related field and 3-5 years of networking experience, or equivalent applicable work experience.
1-2 years help desk experience.
Ability to communicate technical information to nontechnical personnel.
Ability to install, configure and maintain personal computers, networks and related hardware and software.
Knowledge of computer and/or network security systems, applications, procedures and techniques.
Ability to identify and resolve computer system malfunctions and operations problems.
Skill in organizing resources and establishing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to learn and support new systems and applications.
Job Type: Full-time
Required experience:
help desk: 3 years

Keystone's Customer Service Philosophy
Every contact with a client, or a potential client, is an opportunity to build trust and a professional relationship. All employees must consciously and consistently practice this philosophy.
Help Desk Technician
The Help Desk is the face of the company. The Technician is first person to take phone calls and emails from clients requesting help or information. The Technician determines the nature of the clients' problems and attempts to resolve the problems. If the problem is found to be more complicated than can be solved immediately, the Technician then decides how to move forward resolving the customer's problem.

We hire and train the best IT professionals in the business and provide high-touch, elite customer service.
Our nationwide team implements and supports managed IT and cloud offerings better and more cost effectively than any competitor.
We are the pre-eminent supplier of managed IT solutions to small and medium sized business customers.
THE NUTS AND BOLTS
Provide remote customer technical support. Receive incoming calls from clients looking for solutions to technical problems.
Manage RMM client portal setups and configurations. Monitor clients on the portal.
Coordinate client-site technicians and support Pure Channel IT vCIOs.
Troubleshoot and coordinate with RMM provider NOC.
Continue to develop your skills and eventually move into a Sales Engineer and/or leadership role.
WHAT YOU BRING
A passion for technology.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
A minimum of 1 year of experience as a Help Desk Analyst or Network Administrator or similar role. We will consider entry-level candidates, but you must be able to demonstrate a basic level of technical aptitude and ambitious personality.
Knowledge of the following terms and technical tools: Active Directory and group policies, routing and switching, firewalls, configuring and managing mobile devices and patch management.
Excellent client relationship skills and troubleshooting abilities. Should be able to handle easy to more difficult technical issues with customers.
Strong desire to learn and develop your skills. You want a career, not just a job.
Join a company with a bright future, where your technical expertise, ambition and drive to succeed will be rewarded!
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $32,000.00 to $38,000.00 /year
Required experience:
Help Desk: 1 year

16.job_summary:
Solidus is seeking a Systems Administrator. The successful candidate will support a team researching and prototyping leading-edge, laser and quantum optical communications technologies. Current areas of research supported include single-photon detector arrays, coherent modems, integrated photonic circuits, and novel modulation and coding approaches. This research is enabled by a well-maintained network of Windows, Linux, and Mac OS personal computers, servers, network attached storage devices, and specialized laboratory equipment.
The Systems Administrator will be responsible for procuring, configuring, and maintaining the Optical Communication Technology group's computing, data storage, and networking hardware/software. These responsibilities include off-loading and expediting the group's support requests from the on site helpdesk. The successful candidate will also responsible for complying with security policies set forth by the Information Security Dept. and research sponsors.
Relevant hardware includes nearly 50 desktop and notebook PCs, as well as several rack-mounted servers, running Windows 7 Enterprise, Linux (CentOS 6 & 7), and Mac OS. Some computers operate in laboratories connected to instruments and prototype equipment or have data acquisition cards installed. The system administrator will assist group members configure device drivers, install engineering software, archive data, and provide general technical support.
Requirements:
- US Citizenship and the ability to obtain a DoD Secret Clearance
- MS with at least 8 years of system administration experience; A degree in an information technology related field, although additional experience may compensate for the lack of a degree
- Strong interpersonal and communication skills
- A solid understanding of Windows, Linux, Mac and network administration (including OS installation and patching
- Ability to write Bash, Python, VBScript, or Windows PowerShell scripts
- Liaison with on site Information Services and Security Services Departments to comply with security requirements
- Strong problem-solving skills
- Self-directed, eager to learn, and works well alone or in a team
- Can present to an internal audience on hardware/software issues and security policies
- Ability to write purchase justifications
Additionally Desired:
- Virtual machine support (including ESX Server)
- Program and group server management and configuration support (including Active Directory account management)
- Private network support (including hardware, policy) and compliance with information security requirements
Applicants selected must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. U.S. Citizenship may be required. Solidus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. NOTICE OF AFFIRMATIVE ACTION PLAN FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, DISABLED VETERANS AND OTHER PROTECTED VETERANS. It is the policy of this Company to seek and employ qualified individuals at all locations and facilities, and to provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees in recruiting, hiring, placement, training, compensation, insurance, benefits, promotion, transfer, and termination. To achieve this, we are dedicated to taking affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans, and other protected veterans. The objective in adopting the Affirmative Action Programs is to place qualified individuals with disabilities, disabled veterans and other protected veterans in all job classifications. These Affirmative Action Programs are available for inspection by any applicant or employee by contacting the Company's EEO Coordinator, in the Human Resources office, Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm
